mil3.1.2:1.1: “How many rains do you have, venerable Nāgasena?”
mil3.1.2:1.3: “What are these seven, venerable sir, are you the seven, or is the reckoning seven?”
mil3.1.2:2.1: Then, at that time, the shadow of the kingadorned with all his ornaments, all decked up and prepared, appeared on theground and is seen in a vessel of water.
mil3.1.2:2.2: Then venerable Nāgasena said this to KingMilinda,
mil3.1.2:2.3: “This shadow appears on the ground and in thevessel of water. Are you the king, your majesty, or is the shadow the king?”
mil3.1.2:2.4: “I am the king, venerable Nāgasena, this shadowis not the king. The shadow comes into existence dependent on me.”
mil3.1.2:2.5: “In the same way, your majesty, seven is thereckoning of rains. I am not the seven, but dependent on me seven comes into existence, similarly to your shadow, your majesty.”
mil3.1.2:2.6: “Wonderful, venerable Nāgasena! Marvelous, venerable Nāgasena! Your answers to the questions asked are very brilliant!”
